history.content:
From the Berkeley enrollment website (http://registrar.berkeley.edu/registration/enrollment):

  • Undergraduates are limited to no more than 13.5 units during Phase 1 and 17.5 units during Phase 2, which includes waitlisted units. (For graduates, the limit for Phase 1 is 12 units, and for Phase 2 it is 20.5 units.) This is a hard cap enforcement. You are free to enroll for more units during the Adjustment Period in August (fall) / January (spring).

Note that if you're using the swap feature (making sure to check waitlist if full), it will not count towards the unit cap.

I originally wanted to swap out one of my three classes for CS170 a little after phase I, but then the swap didn't work, and it automatically put me on the waitlist for that class. I am currently enrolled in 3 4-unit classes and waitlisted for 170 and I was wondering if that was ok.
history.subject: Does being waitlisted for a class count towards the 13.5 Phase 1 unit cap?
